multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. I've been dealing with a rash that started on my face and has spread to my entire body, along with a cough and a runny nose for the past week.

Has there been a fever associated with these symptoms?
Yes, I have a fever.
Have you been vaccinated for measles?
My immunization records are not available.

The examination notes an erythematous rash with some areas that are blanching and partially confluent, but it does not specifically mention spots with blue-white centers.

I have been attending an after-school child care program, but there is no specific information about contact with anyone having similar symptoms or a measles diagnosis.
Final Diagnosis: Measles
